_header: Guk guk good day sir gape while ye get it
_description: Robert Henryson, ‘Sum practysis of Medecyne’ — ninety lines in seven stanzas

Banna.First Lines:
Guk guk gud day schir gaip quhill ȝe get itSic greting may
                    gane weill gud laik in ȝour hude…
Banna.Last Lines: …It is ane mirk mirrourane vþir manis erss
Banna.Note:
Second occurrence in MS; used as introduction to first part of MS,
                    ‘contenand ballattis of theoligie’ (f. 43); here just the one stanza
                    alone in centre of page, facing first folio of MS.
